page.title: 10Mynydd Newydd
page.content: Mynydd Newydd in English is{"New {Mountain".}Today Mynydd Newydd playing fields has facilities for Rugby, Association Football,Cricket and Netball.The area used to be a coal mine called{"Mynydd Newydd Colliery",} so when it rains the pitches become practically unplayable,because the coal under the ground doesn't let the water drain away quickly enough. The Colliery was opened in{1840}and was abandoned in{1933}because of floods.In{1844}there was an explosion. Five miners were killed. With the owners consent the miners built two underground chapels hewn out of coal, they built these in memory of the miners.They met in these chapels every Monday at 6 a.m. for a Prayer Meeting. These must be two of the most unusual chapels in recorded history.
